channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ukraine claims drone strike on Russian oil refinery
item.description: Russia says it shot down more than 120 drones overnight, in what would be one of the largest attacks of the war.

item.title: Pakistan Youtuber ordered to make welfare videos for owning lion
item.description: Court orders Rajab Butt to produce one video a month for a year after he was given cub as wedding gift.

item.title: The U.S. just experienced its slowest annual sales of homes since 1995
item.description: The market sputtered amid high mortgage rates, high prices, and homeowners with lower rates who have no plans to move.

item.title: ‘We’ve got to move forward’ - Michigan electric vehicle industry responds to Trump policy changes
item.description: President Trump has slashed a slew of EV-related policies, which could affect many states that have received billions of dollars in investment for ele...

item.title: Hamas names next Israeli hostages set to be released
item.description: Four are due to be freed in a second exchange of hostages for Palestinian prisoners held in Israel.

item.title: Rebels kill DR Congo governor as fighting intensifies - reports
item.description: Conflict in eastern DR Congo's has forced 400,000 people to flee their homes this year alone, the UN says.

item.title: 5 years after Fang Fang recorded Wuhan lockdown, 2 of her books are being translated
item.description: Chinese author Fang Fang posted notes online while being quarantined in Wuhan. They became Wuhan Diary . She talks with us about two more of her books...

item.title: The debut of new pandas in D.C. marks the latest chapter in China's 'panda diplomacy'
item.description: Friday's debut of new pandas at the National Zoo in D.C. is the latest chapter in a long tale of "panda diplomacy" between China and the rest of the w...

item.title: "Narco-sub" breaks apart while being towed by fishing boat
item.description: Drug traffickers, especially from Colombia, have been caught using submarines to transport cocaine into Mexico, and from there into the U.S.

item.title: Exerts debunk "autism detox" misinformation. Here's what to know.
item.description: "Autism detox" treatments, which include minerals like zeolite, are rising in popularity for promising to treat or reverse the diagnosis. Experts warn...

item.title: Trump targets California water policy as he prepares to tour LA fire damage
Giant pandas debut to public at National Zoo, continuing historic partnership
item.description: Bao Li and Qing Bao, the two giant pandas from China, are 3 years old and arrived in October. After taking a few months to settle in, they're making t...

item.title: Hamas has named the next 4 hostages it will release as part of ceasefire with Israel
item.description: All four hostages are female Israeli soldiers. They are expected to be released Saturday in accordance with a ceasefire agreement with Israel that's h...

item.title: Senate set to hold final vote on Hegseth's confirmation as defense secretary
item.description: The Senate is set to hold its final confirmation vote Friday on President Trump's embattled pick for secretary of defense, Pete Hegseth. CBS News poli...

item.title: Cancer affects your life for years after diagnosis. Here are survivors' stories
item.description: Medical advances mean many more people are surviving cancer and living for years or decades with its after effects. Here's how they are navigating lif...

item.title: Judge rejects US mother's extradition challenge
item.description: Kimberlee Singler is wanted in Colorado to face a seven-count indictment - including first-degree murder.

item.title: The radical lives of single men and women in the focolare movement
item.description: In the latest installment of the "CBS Mornings" series "The State of Spirituality with Lisa Ling," the Focolare Movement is explored.

item.title: Trump departs White House to visit disaster zones in North Carolina and California
